user_prompt: Graphical abstract for KGGEN-CUAD Knowledge Graph System: Shows the end-to-end pipeline from legal contracts (stack of documents) through KGGEN extraction stages (entity extraction, aggregation, entity resolution with clustering) to knowledge graph construction with CUAD ontology showing 41 label categories organized in three groups (General Information, Restrictive Covenants, Revenue Risks), culminating in LLM-based contract analysis retrieval system with lawyer interface. Include contract documents on left, knowledge graph network visualization in center with nodes and edges, and AI assistant interface for lawyers on right. Show data flow with arrows.

iterations.prompt:
Create a high-quality scientific diagram with these requirements:

VISUAL QUALITY:
- Clean white or light background (no textures or gradients)
- High contrast for readability and printing
- Professional, publication-ready appearance
- Sharp, clear lines and text
- Adequate spacing between elements to prevent crowding

TYPOGRAPHY:
- Clear, readable sans-serif fonts (Arial, Helvetica style)
- Minimum 10pt font size for all labels
- Consistent font sizes throughout
- All text horizontal or clearly readable
- No overlapping text

SCIENTIFIC STANDARDS:
- Accurate representation of concepts
- Clear labels for all components
- Include scale bars, legends, or axes where appropriate
- Use standard scientific notation and symbols
- Include units where applicable

ACCESSIBILITY:
- Colorblind-friendly color palette (use Okabe-Ito colors if using color)
- High contrast between elements
- Redundant encoding (shapes + colors, not just colors)
- Works well in grayscale

LAYOUT:
- Logical flow (left-to-right or top-to-bottom)
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Balanced composition
- Appropriate use of whitespace
- No clutter or unnecessary decorative elements


USER REQUEST: Graphical abstract for KGGEN-CUAD Knowledge Graph System: Shows the end-to-end pipeline from legal contracts (stack of documents) through KGGEN extraction stages (entity extraction, aggregation, entity resolution with clustering) to knowledge graph construction with CUAD ontology showing 41 label categories organized in three groups (General Information, Restrictive Covenants, Revenue Risks), culminating in LLM-based contract analysis retrieval system with lawyer interface. Include contract documents on left, knowledge graph network visualization in center with nodes and edges, and AI assistant interface for lawyers on right. Show data flow with arrows.

Generate a publication-quality scientific diagram that meets all the guidelines above.

early_stop_reason: Quality score 7.5 meets threshold 7.5 for report
